page.title: 14PRIMARY SCHOOL,THREE CROSSES
page.content: Three Crosses,or Crwys, Primary School celebrated its centenary in 1975.In 1918 its catchment area was extended to include part of Dunvant.With extensive housing development in Dunvant during the 1950's and 1960's the School premises were inadequate to house all the pupils.In 1972 Glamorgan Education Authority opened a new school at Dunvant for the children of that area.The number of children attending Crwys School was therefore cut dramatically and the School reverted to its original role of catering for its own village children including those of nursery age.Sports facilities are limited,use having to be made of the village green or 'Banc' as it is known,any inter-school foot- ball matches having to be arranged on pitches some distance from the village.
